sn35.73:4.1: “Mendicants, anyone who doesn’t truly understand the six fields of contact’s origin, ending, gratification, drawback, and escape
sn35.73:4.2: has not lived the spiritual life and is far from this teaching and training.”
sn35.73:5.1: When he said this, one of the mendicants said to the Buddha:
sn35.73:5.3: For I don’t truly understand the six fields of contact’s origin, ending, gratification, drawback, and escape.”
sn35.73:6.1: “What do you think, mendicant? Is the eye permanent or impermanent?”
sn35.73:8.1: “But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?”
sn35.73:10.1: “But if it’s impermanent, suffering, and liable to fall apart, is it fit to be regarded thus:
sn35.73:10.2: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
sn35.73:14.1: “But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?”
sn35.73:16.1: “But if it’s impermanent, suffering, and liable to fall apart, is it fit to be regarded thus:
sn35.73:16.2: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
sn35.73:18.1: “Seeing this, a learned noble disciple becomes disillusioned with the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.
sn35.73:18.4: When freed, they know ‘it is freed’.
sn35.73:18.5: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”
